summary:
• Australia's renowned "Space Gandalf" astronomer passes away at 62.
• The late scientist was known for his groundbreaking discoveries in space exploration and astronomy.
• His legacy continues to inspire new generations of scientists and explorers.

• Joe Biden is set to deliver a speech in France, emphasizing his commitment to defending democracy.
• He will participate in commemorating the 80th anniversary of D-Day alongside world leaders and veterans.
• This event highlights Biden's stance on democracy, contrasting with that of former President Donald Trump.

• Dr. Michael Mosley is missing in Greece
• He is known for popularizing the 5:2 diet
• Authorities are searching for him

* Modi will be sworn in as India's Prime Minister on Sunday.
* The opposition accuses Modi of being involved in a stock market scam.
* A gunman opened fire at the US Embassy in Lebanon, but was shot by the army before any harm was done.

• Irish economy returns to growth
• Pit bull terrier shot by Irish police after two injured
• Irish polls open for local and EU elections

• The United States is urging Israel to be more transparent about its actions regarding the recent strike on a school in Gaza.
• Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu will speak before a joint meeting of both houses of Congress in July.
• The UN has accused Israel of using American-made ammunition in the attack on a UN school that resulted in the deaths of many innocent children.
• A deadline has been set for Israel to improve their treatment of detained Palestinians or face international consequences.
• Detention centers in Israel have been reported as having committed human rights violations, including torture, abuse, and mistreatment of prisoners.

• Israel may launch an attack on Lebanon amid escalating violence with Hezbollah.
• US President Joe Biden visits France to commemorate D-Day, highlighting differences from predecessor Donald Trump.
• Tensions between Israel and Hezbollah escalate, threatening regional stability.

• The military junta has inflicted widespread human rights abuses and political repression on its citizens.
• The economic sanctions imposed by international governments have led to a significant decline in trade and investment.
• The ongoing violence and instability have resulted in the displacement of thousands of people and the destruction of infrastructure.

• The European Union parliamentary election has commenced in the Netherlands.
• A recent exit poll indicates a close competition between parties vying for leadership.
• The outcome remains uncertain due to the unpredictable nature of the contest.

• Cyril Ramaphosa believes unity government is SA's best option.
• He advocates for unity among political parties to address challenges.
• A unified government would benefit the country economically and socially.

• North Korea launched balloons carrying propaganda materials into South Korea.
• Activists in South Korea responded by sending K-pop music to counter the propaganda.
• The balloon incident highlights tensions between the two nations.

• Ukrainian President Zelensky calls D-Day veteran a hero
• Zelensky honors D-Day veteran as a hero
• Power outages in Ukraine due to Russian airstrikes on energy facilities

• Refugees on a remote UK island discuss their experiences in interviews with the BBC.
• Two UK judges severed ties with Hong Kong's judicial system due to political reasons.
• World War II veterans commemorate the 80th anniversary of D-Day.

• Hunter Biden's ex-girlfriend found a gun and panicked.
• Eleven people were sent to the hospital due to extreme heat during an Arizona Trump rally.
• Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu will be addressing the U.S. Congress on July 24th.
